annote: This paper provides a exact truthmaker-based semantics for the conflict-tolerant deontic logic BDL (bringing the long search for a semantics to an end). The clause for the obligation operator is notably different from the ones in (Fine 2018b,c).
title: Truthmakers and normative conflicts

annote: In this note, van Benthem provides a translation of the exact truthmaker framework into Modal Information Logic. It contains a very useful discussion of the result and possible ways in which truthmaker semantics and modal logic approaches can inform each other.
title: Truth maker semantics and modal information logic

annote: Mainly on impossible worlds but contains remarks on truthmaker semantics in a couple of places: (i) the discussion on p. 30 outlines an argument for the unsuitability of truthmaker semantics for intentional purposes; (ii) the discussion on p. 77 presents an argument against the existence of non-obtaining states of affairs based on truthmaker-considerations (with reference to earlier work by Jago); (iii) §6.5 (p. 139–140) contains a discussion of a truthmaker of the ternary relation in the semantics for relevance logic, based on/referencing (Jago 2013).
title: Impossible worlds

annote: Seems to be a proceedings/talk version of (Burke 2019b).
container-title: Proceedings of the sixth workshop on natural language and computer science
title: Monads for hyperintensionality? A situation semantics for hyperintensional side effects

annote: Modifies HYPE (Leitgeb 2019) using monads from category theory. From a truthmaker semantics perspective, it’s probably best viewed as a variant of inexact truthmaker semantics.
title: P-HYPE: A monadic situation semantics for hyperintensional side effects
On the logic of factual equivalence

annote: Provides an interesting argument for the primacy of inexact truthmaking: the claim that we can define exact in terms of inexact truthmaking and not the other way around (which is what we standardly assume in the exact truthmaking literature). Best enjoyed together with (Leitgeb 2020).
title: A plea for inexact truthmaking

annote: Applies the theory from (Elgin 2018a) to argue for certain claims in the context of the physicalism debate.
keyword: philosophy, philosophy of mind, exact truthmaking
title: Physicalism and the identity of identity theories

annote: Provides an analysis of philosophical analysis in an exact truthmaker setting.
title: The semantic foundations of philosophical analysis

annote: Presents a problem for the exact truthmaker semantics for counterfactuals developed in (Fine 2012b)
title: Counterfactuals without possible worlds? A difficulty for fine’s exact semantics for counterfactuals

annote: Contains a framework for the treatment of hyperintensionality in normative context with applications of exact truthmaker semantics. Is based on the author’s PhD thesis.
keyword: philosophy, normativity, logic, applications, exact truthmaking
title: Hyperintensionality and normativity

annote: Alternative treatment of negation in an exact truthmaker setting.
title: Negation and events as truthmakers

annote: This review of Lewis’s Counterfactuals makes an indirect appeal to the intuitive idea behind the exact truthmaker clauses in the context of the problem of disjunctive simplification in counterfactuals (p. 454). But he doesn’t go into much detail nor does he make reference to the formal clauses. The paper doesn’t reference (Fraassen 1969).
title: Critical notice

annote: Gives an argument for the hyperintensionality of counterfactuals. Companion to (Fine 2012b).
title: A difficulty for the possible worlds analysis of counterfactuals

annote: Contains an argument for the hyperintensionality of counterfactuals and an exact truthmaker semantics for (non-iterated) counterfactuals. Great in combination with (Fine 2012a).
title: Counterfactuals without possible worlds

annote: One of the first occurences of the exact truthmaker frameworks in Fine’s work is in the proposed semantics for statements of ground in §1.10, p. 71–74.
container-title: Metaphysical grounding. Understanding the structure of reality
title: Guide to ground

annote: Contains a version of the semantics from (Fine 2012c) for a logic of ground without logical connectives.
keyword: philosophy, metaphysics, logic, applications, exact truthmaking
title: The pure logic of ground

annote: Develops an exact truthmaker setting for intuitionistic logic and provides a characterization for intuitionistic consequence in terms of inexact consequence in this setting. Also contains a philosophical discussion.
keyword: logic, intuitionistic logic, conditionals, exact truthmaking
title: Truth-maker semantics for intuitionistic logic

annote: Contains arguments for the hyperintensionality of certain concepts of permission and a sketch of a positive, exact truthmaker based proposal for a semantics of permission statements.
title: Permission and possible worlds

annote: Presents an exact truthmaker semantics for Angell’s logic AC. This is the first intuitive semantics for this system. The paper introduces the convexivity condition on exact truthmakers. Also the idea of using DNF’s in completeness proofs seems to make its first appearence here.
title: Angellic content

annote: Together with (FIne 2017b), this outlines a (formal) theory of propositions as sets of truthmakers (or constructs thereof).
title: A theory of truthmaker content i: Conjunction, disjunction and negation
title-short: A theory of truthmaker content i

annote: Together with (Fine 2017a), this outlines a (formal) theory of propositions as sets of truthmakers (or constructs thereof).
title: A theory of truthmaker content II: Subject-matter, common content, remainder and ground
title-short: A theory of truthmaker content II

annote: This is the authoritative introduction to the topic of (exact) truthmaker semantics.
container-title: A companion to the philosophy of language
title: Truthmaker semantics

annote: General outline of (exact) truthmaker semantics, especially focused on comparisons with possible-worlds semantics.
container-title: Being Necessary: Themes of Ontology and Modality from the Work of Bob Hale
title: The world of truth-making

annote: Together with (Fine 2018c) a fairly comprehensive treatment of deontic/normative concepts in exact truthmaker semantics. The treatment notably doesn’t cover iterated deontics etc.
title: Compliance and command i: Categorical imperatives

annote: Together with (Fine 2018c) a fairly comprehensive treatment of deontic/normative concepts in exact truthmaker semantics. The treatment notably doesn’t cover iterated deontics etc.
title: Compliance and command II: Imperatives and deontics

annote: Explication of the Is–Ought gap using exact truthmakers.
title: Truthmaking and the is–ought gap

annote: Provides an exact truthmaker account of truth-likeness.
title: Verisimilitude and truthmaking

annote: Critical discussion of Yablo’s inexact truthmaker account of aboutness and subject-matter from (Yablo 2014) coming from an exact truthmaker perspective.
title: Yablo on subject-matter

annote: Treats exact truthmaker preservation across all models as a (non-classical) consequence relation and investigates the resulting logic using logical methods. Contains various interesting technical results.
title: Logic for exact entailment

annote: This is the first article in which the exact truthmaker clauses appear (p. 484). However, van Fraassen uses them to provide an inexact truthmaker semantics for what’s known today as the logic of First Degree Entailment (or, in his time, tautological entailment).
keyword: logic, philosophy, relevance, exact truthmaking, inexact truthmaking, theory
title: Facts and tautological entailments

annote: In this article, the exact clauses occur in the context of a semantic analysis of adverbs and a fine-grained theory of properties (p. 123). In footnote 11, van Fraassen traces the semantic approach to his earlier paper (Fraassen 1969).
keyword: logic, philosophy, exact truthmaking, inexact truthmaking, linguistics, applications
title: Extension, intension, and comprehension

annote: In this paper, the exact truthmaker clauses make an occurrence in van Fraassen’s semantic models for relevantist probability theory (p. 54). The clauses are not directly imposed on the models but rather figure in a derived proposition.
title: Gentlemen’s wagers: Relevant logic and probability

annote: Compares various accounts of hyperintensional content. Ch. 5 contains a discussion of Fine’s approach.
publisher: University of Amsterdam, Institute for Logic, Language,; Computation
title: Hyperintensionality

annote: Provides an exact truthmaker semantics for indicative conditionals starting from Fine’s semantics for counterfactuals in (Fine 2012b).
title: Exact semantics for indicative conditionals

annote: Discusses or-to-if inferences in the semantics developed in (Güngör 2017 and 2019c).
title: Or-to-if inferences in contextualist truthmaker semantics

annote: Analyses the Two Stitches puzzle from Ciardelli, Champollion, and Zhang using Fine’s exact truthmaker semantics for counterfactuals from (Fine 2012b)
title: Two switches and truthmaker semantics

annote: Paper-length exposition of the semantics in (Güngör 2017).
title: Truthmaking indicative conditionals

annote: This paper is mentioned by (Fine 1975) as an explicit precursor to exact truthmaker semantics.
title: Radical inquisitive semantics

annote: Surveys various possible exact truthmaker semantics for epistemic logic.
container-title: Outstanding contributions to logic: Kit fine
title: Truthmaker semantics for epistemic logic

annote: Discusses whether truthmaking implies relevance. Makes explicit reference to (Fraassen 1969 and Restall 1996).
title: Truthmaking and the alleged need for relevance

annote: Surveys various “logics of synonymy,” i.e. logical systems based on a synonymy operator. Uses AC with the semantics from (Fine 2016) as one of its benchmarks. Contains an interesting no-go theorem that applies to AC.
title: Logics of synonymy

annote: Mentioned by Fine (Fine 2017, p. 575) as an "early adopter" of the exact clauses. Concerns adverbial constructions, similar to (Fraassen 1973).
container-title: Situation thoery and its applications. Volume 3
publisher: Center for the Study of Language; Information
title: Episodic logic: A situational logic for natural language processing

annote: Contains a brief discussion of truthmakers and their relation to relevant logic (Restall 1996).
title: Recent work in relevant logic

annote: Presents a theory of propositions based on (exact) truthmakers.
title: Propositions as truthmaker conditions

annote: Presents an exact truthmaker semantics for the relevance logic R. Note especially the alternative treatment of disjunctions.
keyword: logic, relevance, exact truthmaking, inexact truthmaking
title: Truthmaker semantics for relevant logic

annote: Further refines ideas of (Jago 2020) in the context of the relation of disjunctive parts (in contrast to the concept of conjunctive parts discussed, e.g., in (Fine 2016)).
container-title: Outstanding contributions to logic: Kit fine
title: Disjunctive parts

annote: Extends the framework of exact truthmaker semantics with the resources of two-dimensional semantics.
title: Two-dimensional truthmaker semantics

annote: Evaluates the exact truthmaker semantics for intuitionistic logic from (Fine 2014a) by comparing it to Martin-Löf type theory.
title: Truthmaker semantics: Fine versus martin-löf

annote: Contains a semantics for deontic operators different from (Fine 2018b and 2018c).
container-title: Deontic logic and normative systems. 13th international conference, DEON 2016, bayeruth, germany, july 18-21, 2016
title: An exact truthmaker semantics for permission and obligation

annote: Proposes a criterion for probabilistic (ir)relevance in a broadly Bayesian framework extended with exact truthmaker resources.
keyword: philosophy, applications, probability, relevance, exact truthmaking
title: A hyperintensional criterion of irrelevance

annote: Formulates an account of what it means to give the “whole truth” and formally models it in exact truthmaker semantics.
container-title: Outstanding contributions to logic: Kit fine
title: The whole truth

annote: New system hyperintensional semantics/logic, which from the perspective of truthmaker semantics can best be viewed as a form of inexact truthmaker semantics. Contains a very interesting philosphical application.
title: HYPE: A system of hyperintensional logic (with an application to semantic paradoxes)

annote: Explains the philosophical idea behind a proposal for defining inexact in terms of exact truthmaking (contra “tradition”). Good pairing with (Deigan 2019a).
container-title: Logic in high definition. Trends in logical semantics
keyword: philosophy, inexact truthmaking, exact truthmaking, theory
title: Exact truthmaking as inexact truthmaking by minimal totality facts

annote: Applications of exact truthmaker semantics in linguistics.
container-title: Act-based conceptions of propositional content. Contemporary and historical perspectives
title: Cognitive products and the semantics of attitude verbs and deontic modals

annote: Applications of exact truthmaker semantics in linguistics.
title: An object-based truthmaker semantics for modals

annote: Applications of exact truthmaker semantics in linguistics.
container-title: Metaphysics, meaning, and modality: Themes from kit fine
title: Variable objects and truthmaking

annote: Applications of exact truthmaker semantics in linguistics.
title: Truthmaker semantics for natural language: Attitude verbs, modals, and intensional transitive verbs

annote: Compares HYPE to Heyting-Ockam logic. Contains a characterization of HYPE as identical to a modal system introduced by Moisil. From the perspective of truthmaker semantics, these results can be understood as results about (a certain kind of) inexact truthmaker semantics.
title: Routley star and hyperintensionality

publisher: University of Amsterdam, Institute for Logic, Language,; Computation
title: Another approach to truthmaker semantics

annote: Relates truthmaking to relevant entailment (in particular, the first-degree fragment of RM). As such, it can be seen as a predecessor of the ideas of exact truthmaker semantics.
title: Truthmakers, entailment, and necessity

annote: Provides a model for the proposal from (Restall 1996).
title: Modelling truthmaking

publisher: University of Amsterdam, Institute for Logic, Language,; Computation
title: A truthmaker semantics approach to modal logic

annote: Deals with hyperintensional logics in general but contains a quick remark (3.1) on truthmaker semantics.
title: Hyperintensional logics for everyone

annote: In this article, the exact truthmaker clauses occur in the context of a semantics for relevant deontic logic (p. 197). There is no citation of neither van Fraassen’s nor Fine’s work. It’s unclear whether the exactness idea plays an important role in the paper.
title: Relevant deontic logic
Sextus empiricus’ fourth conditional and containment logic

annote: An inexact truthmaker approach to indicative conditionals, which relies on minimal truthmakers.
title: Ifs, ands, and buts: An incremental truthmaker semantics for indicative conditionals

annote: §4 contains an extensive discussion of truthmakers as a semantic framework. Yablo favors inexact truthmakers over exact truthmakers. His theory of aboutness involves minimal truthmakers.
title: Aboutness
